Critical Fall Precaution: Carpet edges should be secured. Throw rugs are discouraged, but if used they need to have a nonslip surface
Critical Fall Precaution: Communicate Critical Fall Risk to all team members
Critical Fall Precaution: Consult with physician on poly-pharmacy, rehab service, lab, and comorbidities
Critical Fall Precaution: Educate patient and care partners on risk factors and prevention
Critical Fall Precaution: Escort patient to and from dialysis chair. Offer wheelchair and document any type of refusal
Critical Fall Precaution: Home visit recommended
Critical Fall Precaution: If assistance devices such as cane, walker, wheelchair, etc. are used, keep within reach, but not in main traffic area
Critical Fall Precaution: If grab bars are being used, be sure they are firmly attached
Critical Fall Precaution: If patient requires assistance to bathroom, stay with patient providing privacy as indicated
Critical Fall Precaution: Keep home hallways free of boxes, supplies or obstacles
Critical Fall Precaution: Keep room lighting adequate
Critical Fall Precaution: Keep spills wiped up and floor free of debris
Critical Fall Precaution: Pathway to bathroom should be unobstructed. Secure equipment and cords out of pathway
